metadata.synopsis: If Isobel and Nightsong survive Act 2 they will be having a heartfelt reunion during the Epilogue
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Run oe SCE_SetupNightsong_FreedFromShar or oe SCE_SetupNightsong_FreedFromColony2. Run oe SCE_SetupDebrief3. Run teleport S_SHA_Nightsong

34.speaker: Nightsong
34.text: Begone! I must admire Isobel's fulsome beauty away from prying eyes.
34.context: NodeContext: Whispered as an aside to the player but in good humour. She's delighted with how Nightsong is acting

11.speaker: Isobel
11.context: NodeContext: Whispered as an aside to the player but in good humour. She's delighted with how Nightsong is acting

40.speaker: Isobel
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel and Nightsong (now Aylin) spot each other from across the room. Both are full of bewilderment, pain, and joy. [ChadD] Shoot entire sequence in mocap stage with two actors Aylin starts with her back to Isobel. Hears her name, briefly hesitates and begins to turn to the familiar voice.NodeContext: holding back a sob - disbelieving

46.speaker: Nightsong
46.context: CinematicNodeContext:  [ChadD] Shoot entire sequence in mocap stage with two actors.  Aylin, is exhausted, unsteady on her feet. Sees Isobel, gasps, tension releasing from her body. Isobel is walking slowly towards her.NodeContext: also disbelieving. Aylin is unsteady on her feet. She's been through 100 years of torment, fought Ketheric Thorm, and now she's seeing the love of her life, who she thought dead.

20.speaker: Nightsong
20.text: My love... you were dead. I saw your body...
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel approaches her eagerly. [ChadD] Shoot whole sequence.  Aylin takes off her halm and lowers it before casting it aside. Her armor begins to glitter and fade.  Aylin is unsteady on her feet, drops to her knees. Armor and wings fading. Isobel closes the distance as Aylin says her line.NodeContext: to the ground. Aylin falls to her knees, weakened by battle and disbelief

1.speaker: Isobel
1.text: I'm here. A-and so are you. And my father, he - he can't hurt us any longer.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel places a hand on Aylin's shoulder, then her cheek/chin, and raises Aylin's face to meet her gaze. (removes touch while speaking) After Isobel speaks, she helps Aylin rise to her full height.[ChadD] Shoot whole sequence. NodeContext: Chokes up on 'my father, he - '. Still generally disbelieving.

25.speaker: Nightsong
25.text: I dreamt every night that you'd come back to me. That somehow it was all a nightmare dawn would undo.
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: [ChadD] Shoot whole sequence. Begins line and partway through Alyin pulls Isobel in, they deeply embrace. Disbelief turning to releif.NodeContext: On 'come back to me,' Aylin breaks the embrace and looks into Isobel's eyes. We want to feign contact here (cinematic constraint) while still maintaining closeness/ implying hand-holding. CC Greg

63.speaker: Isobel
63.text: I had no dreams at all. Nothing but darkness. And when I awoke, my father said you were dead.
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: [ChadD] Shoot whole sequence. They slightly part, still in eachothers arms, looking into eachothers eyes.NodeContext: mirthless humor - reflecting on the bleak reality

31.speaker: Nightsong
31.text: His soul was poisoned by the god of death. His sick devotion ruined him.
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: [ChadD] Shoot whole sequence. Still looking into eachothers eyes.

65.speaker: Nightsong
65.text: But for all his sins, he brought you back to me. Are you all right?
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: [ChadD] Shoot whole sequence. Aylin slightly leans back, searching isobels eyes.  Isobel rasises a trembling hand towards Aylins face. (pause in VO while:) Aylin kisses Isobels fingers before asking "Are you..."NodeContext: She leans back, looking into Isobel's eyes, searching them.

57.speaker: Isobel
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: [ChadD] Shoot whole sequence. Isobel leans back smiling as she asks "Are you?"

47.speaker: Nightsong
47.text: In this moment, I want for nothing.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: [ChadD] Shoot whole sequence. After "in this moment," (pause VO) Aylin urgently kisses Isobel. Aylin abruptly lifsts Isobel as she bellows "I want for nothing!"  Both laughing, Isobel still lifted up in Aylins arms, Aylin spins them clockwise. As they spin nightsons wings manifest again before the screen fades to white.NodeContext: with a smile

58.speaker: Isobel
58.text: Ah! There you are. This is Aylin. Aylin, this is -

55.speaker: Nightsong
55.text: This so-called Sharran is known to me. I thought she'd run me through, but she set me free instead.

41.speaker: Nightsong
41.text: Ho! But we have met. This is the soldier that freed me most valiantly from the Shadowfell.

42.speaker: Nightsong
42.text: They watched my boot crush the very brain of villainy - and fought well against your changèd father.

50.speaker: Isobel
50.text: May he rest in peace at last, now that he's dead.
50.context: NodeContext: About her father. Tinged with sadness but not too sad. She's about to thank the player warmly.

66.speaker: Isobel
66.text: I have more to thank you for than I knew. And we have much to discuss. Perhaps we could join you in your camp later?
66.context: NodeContext: Interrupting Aylin who is going on a paladin tirade

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I hardly know you - what's your role in all this?
69.context: NodeContext: Interrupting Aylin who is going on a paladin tirade

56.speaker: Isobel
56.text: That's a very good question. I know some parts. Some I haven't quite figured out. But I'd like to tell you everything I know, if you'll have us at your camp later.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I'd like to hear why you lied to me about being Ketheric's daughter.
29.context: NodeContext: Interrupting Aylin who is going on a paladin tirade

60.speaker: Isobel
60.text: You deserve to know that much - and more. It'll keep. I promise.

39.speaker: Player
39.context: NodeContext: Interrupting Aylin who is going on a paladin tirade

45.speaker: Player
45.text: You there, Sharran - by the fires of your camp's hearth, we will discuss all we must.

48.speaker: Nightsong
48.text: You there, Sharran - by the fires of your camp's hearth, we will discuss all we must.

59.speaker: Shadowheart
59.text: I'll be ready. Whatever you have to say had better be worth your life.

37.speaker: Player
37.context: NodeContext: Interrupting Aylin who is going on a paladin tirade

16.speaker: Isobel
16.text: We'll make our visit brief. Cleric's honour.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: No - if you have something to say to me, say it now.
15.context: NodeContext: Interrupting Aylin who is going on a paladin tirade

33.speaker: Nightsong
33.text: Do not speak so abruptly to the mate of Dame Aylin, daughter of the Moonmaiden, paladin of -
33.context: NodeContext: Interrupting Aylin who is going on a paladin tirade

27.speaker: Isobel
27.text: Ahem. Listen, we need time to figure out what the hells has happened. I thought Aylin dead. She thought the same of me.
27.context: NodeContext: Interrupting Aylin who is going on a paladin tirade

54.speaker: Isobel
54.text: Let us join you later. I'm sure we'd have much of interest to say to one another.
54.context: NodeContext: Hushing Aylin for saying something embarassing, but good-natured

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Yes - but I'll expect you to share what you claim to know about me.
0.context: NodeContext: Hushing Aylin for saying something embarassing, but good-natured

7.speaker: Nightsong
7.text: I gave my word, and I will keep it. By the fires of your camp's hearth, we will discuss all we must.
7.context: NodeContext: Hushing Aylin for saying something embarassing, but good-natured

12.speaker: Nightsong
12.text: Now - you will leave us. We must take succour in one another's bodies and words.
12.context: NodeContext: Hushing Aylin for saying something embarassing, but good-natured

70.speaker: Isobel
70.context: NodeContext: Hushing Aylin for saying something embarassing, but good-natured

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Fine. I'll see you at camp.
44.context: NodeContext: First part to Aylin, Second part to player

8.speaker: Isobel
8.text: Very good. We look forward to it.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I doubt that. You go your way, and I'll go mine.
24.context: NodeContext: First part to Aylin, Second part to player

38.speaker: Nightsong
38.text: We are not welcome, my love. No matter. We will hie us to the Hill of the Headless Dancer and bare our flesh beneath the cleansing light of the moon's soft gaze.
38.context: NodeContext: First part to Aylin, Second part to player

36.speaker: Isobel
36.text: A hundred years hasn't changed you at all, my love. As for you - if we aren't to meet again, I'll say my thank-yous. And my goodbyes.
36.context: NodeContext: First part to Aylin, Second part to player

9.speaker: Isobel
9.text: If we meet again, it will be my pleasure.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Did I hear you correctly before? Are you Ketheric Thorm's daughter?

19.speaker: Isobel
19.text: I am. And I'm glad he's dead. But this is precisely what I want to speak to you about later. It'll keep, I promise.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Firstly, allow me to apologise to Dame Aylin. My actions were strategy - not personal.

49.speaker: Nightsong
49.text: My forgiveness will be the same. I'd be a fool to turn down a powerful ally - especially one who has earned the trust of fair Isobel.

18.speaker: Nightsong
18.text: But Dame Aylin's life is neverending. And she does not forget. Now - I believe Isobel asked a question of you. We will meet you in your camp - is it agreed?

61.speaker: Player
61.text: If Isobel has something to say to me, she can say it now.

3.speaker: Nightsong
3.text: We have met. The instigator of my despair - and then my elation.

21.speaker: Nightsong
21.text: We must watch this one closely, Isobel. Their motivations are suspect - aye, suspect indeed.

51.speaker: Isobel
51.text: Hmm - it sounds like we have much to discuss. Perhaps we could join you in your camp later?

67.speaker: Isobel
67.text: Ah! It's you, isn't it? You're the talk of this place, you know. I'm Isobel, and this is -
